attract.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to make someone interested in something, or make them want to take part in something
attract.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The story has attracted a lot of interest from the media.
What attracted me most to the job was the chance to travel.
attract.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to make someone like or admire something or feel romantically interested in someone
attract.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: I guess it was his eyes that attracted me first.
attract.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to make someone or something move towards another thing
attract.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: low rents designed to attract new businesses to the area
attract.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to make someone want to buy something, do something, or take part in something
attract.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Advertisements for a new headmaster attracted 120 candidates.
What attracted me most to the job was the chance to travel.
attract.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to create conditions where you start getting business or people start investing in your company etc
attract.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Efforts have been made to attract foreign investment.
attract.translation[1].definitions[2].de: if something attracts tax, tax must be paid on it
attract.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: They expect their post-retirement income to attract basic rate tax only.
